intro: Navia lasiantha, commonly known as the silverleaf navia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and its clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Navia lasiantha is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and it has a taproot system that helps it survive in poor soil conditions. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some regions for garden use.
